page.title: 02THE CHURCH, MANOR, AND MILL.
page.content: Hollingbourne is situated on the Pilgrim's and North Downs Ways.The church, rebuilt after the earthquake of 1382 contains, among other treasures, the Culpeper Tapestry. A unique piece of ecclesiastical embroidery, it is a large rectangular piece of velvet, with a deep border of applied motifs depicting in glowing colour various fruits, bordered by cherubs. It was possibly worked by daughters of Thomas Culpeper in the seventeenth century. The Culpepers are connected with the Tudor Manor which faces the church. This building contains evidence of earlier Plantagenet architecture. They also possessed Manor Mill,the last remaining of the four mills on the bourne. Mr. Wratten, the last miller, worked the mill till 1925. The mill wheel remains.
